title: Should Riot Buff up Liandrys Torment?
body:
{{item:3151}}  feels like a very underwhelming item. It gives decent stats IMO, some mpen, health and AP. However, its passive seems really bad, even if boosted when applied to a slowed target, it seems like it doesn't do anything or close to anything, it just feels like stopping the enemy health regen for 2 seconds. Has anyone else thought this item needs to get better? It's quite expensive for an underwhelming passive.

Edit: thanks for your opinions and info. After reading a bit guess it is a good item with the right champion. For example I like it on Galio, since his Q applies a slow for a stronger effect and you can spam Q almost every 4 seconds, but it doesn't seem to do much, hence my question. Maybe I couldve been biased here?

replies.body: More magic pen plz. Riot is killing mages faster than I can believe
I wish it was less restrictive like blade of the ruined king. Mordekaiser could really use the hp removal passive but it's hard to get any reliability out of it because he has no CC.

Considering the main ones who use Liandry's typically make it into a broken item, I think we're all good. You have to understand every single time you proc Liandry's, it does an initial tick. When you see a Malz press W+E+R on a tank with only a Liandry's and a Rylai's and the tank just melts instantly, you can thank Liandry's for proc'ing about three or so times a second. There's also Cass who has 2 DoT's who can proc it 4 times or so a second. 1 from her Q and W, 2 times a second from her E.  Teemo's shrooms don't need a buff. Please, no Teemo Shroom buff. And of course Brand's passive with it is a bit silly at times. Also, Singed is hilarious with Liandry's. Enough said really. :3 We're goooooooood with Liandry's.

that's not how it works...

I stand corrected! They did in fact change this item prior to release. It deals damage every half-second equal to 1% of the target's current health. It still is a bit overly powerful on DPS mages who keep Liandry's torment going for much longer periods of time. Normally, I'd say they could just double it's damage for non-DoT spells, but then they'd have to nerf Cass's E or risk her becoming overly strong, but nerfing it back to not counting as a single-target ability/DoT spell would make Rylai's go back to what it uuuuuuuse to be prior to the QoL buff they gave it a while back where Spell Vamp and Rylai's would properly treat it as a single-target burst spell rather than a DoT spell.
